page.title: 19ENTERTAINMENT PENLLANW
page.content: LOCAL FESTIVAL PENLLANW PORTHMEIRION On May 4 1985 a special festival called Penllanw (Sea & Fun or High Tide) organised by the Urdd was held in Portmeirion. The Urdd is the biggest youth movement in Wales with members from 7 to 30 yrs of age. There are competitions and a mini marathon in the Penllanw. This year was special because it was the tenth anniversary. There were many fund raising stalls. The money is used to help the Urdd finance two youth camps, one on the coast at Llangrannog and the other at Galn llyn on the shores of Bala Lake. at one stall you could get your hair dyed red, white, & green, the Urdd colours. Red represents fellow man, white - Christ, and green - Wales. Folk and pop groups and a choir come to entertain people as they walk about the village.
